definition: (of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: The festival was canceled last year due to hoof-and-mouth disease.
sentences.chinese: 這個節日去年因爲口蹄疫而停擺。

sentences.english: Well, I know you are a huge basketball fan. This lockout, this is really depressing.
sentences.chinese: 好的，您是鐵桿籃球迷，這次停擺肯定讓您鬱悶吧。

sentences.english: The question is, when the lock-out is looming, how long will next season be?
sentences.chinese: 唯一的問題是，如果聯盟停擺，下賽季還能有多長？

sentences.english: That lockout shortened to the season to 50 games.
sentences.chinese: 那次停擺，賽季被縮減到50場比賽。

sentences.english: The last work stoppage occurred in 1998.

definition: could happen at any moment/on the verge
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
to take turns/to work by roster
